title: Create a field
content:
The following task describes how to create a field (including associations) and add it to a record type. For information about adding calculated fields, see Calculated fields. 

Create a field

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Configuration > Studio > Fields.

  2. Select the record type in the drop-down list at the top of the page.

  3. Click New field. The new field displays in the list, with its blank properties in the right pane.

  4. Edit the properties as required.

    1. Properties
      Property Description
      Name

      The name of the field. This field is mandatory.

      The name of out-of-the-box fields is always in upper camel case. For example: ChangeCausedByRequest. You must follow this naming style. The names of all custom fields must end with _c. The system adds this suffix automatically. You do not have to enter it manually. 

      UpperCamelCase is a naming convention where each word in a phrase starts with an uppercase letter, and there are no spaces or underscores between words.
      Domain This property is read-only.
      System This is a system field. You cannot edit a system field or select it for a custom field.
      Multilingual label Service Management displays the label of the field in the user interface. This field is mandatory.
      Logical type The field type. This field is mandatory. For more information, see the Logical type details section.
      Enable sort The user can sort the field when it appears in a record list by clicking the column header.
      Enable search

      The user can filter and generate reports using this field. You can define up to two custom fields per record as Enable search.
      Encrypted Only members of the selected encryption domain can view the field if they select it. Only relevant for fields of type MEDIUM_TEXT, LARGE_TEXT, and RICH_TEXT.
      Encryption domain Select the encryption domain used for this field. This field only appears when you select Encrypted. For more information on encryption domains, see Encryption domains.
      Enforce uniqueness The value entered in the field must be unique. This property can only be set during the creation of custom fields.
      Required Users must give this property a value when editing it from the user interface. This setting does not affect backend API calls.
      Read only Users cannot modify the value of this property through the user interface. This setting does not affect backend API calls.
      Hidden The property is hidden from forms and grids on the user interface. This setting does not affect backend API calls.
      Tooltip The text that appears when you hover over the field.
      Placeholder The text that appears when the field is empty. You can use this to give instructions or reminders to users.
      Enable number formatting When selected, number formatting is applied to numeric fields. For example, the system displays 1,000 instead of 1000. Ensure to turn on the Number formatting option in Application settings. For more information on Number formatting, see Number formatting section under Application settings topic.
      Reference to If any of the Logical type fields are ENTITY_LINK, ENUM, or ENUM_SET, provide a reference to the linked entity.

  5. Click Save. 

Create a relation field (association)

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Configuration > Studio > Fields.

  2. Select the record type in the drop-down list at the top of the page.

  3. Click New association.

  4. Edit the properties as required.

    Properties
    Property Description
    Name The name of the relation field.
    Multilingual label The display label of the relation field.
    Opposite label The display label of the relation field on the target record type.
    Logical type This property is read only and can only be MANY2MANY.
    Target record type

    The target record type of the relation. If the source record type is a custom record type, the Target record type property can be either an OOTB or a custom record type. If the source record type is an OOTB record type, the Target record type property is affected by the Enable a custom association between two out-of-the-box record types application setting. When this application setting is enabled, any record type can be selected. When this application is disabled, only a custom record type can be selected.

  5. Click Save.

After the relation field is created, you can no longer modify the Target Entity property value or delete the relation field from the record type.
